==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|p}} – objects strung together.

===Etymology===
Cognate with {{och-l|穿|to pierce through; to wear}}, {{och-l|貫|to penetrate}}.

===Pronunciation 1===
{{zh-pron
|m=chuàn,er=y
|c=cyun3
|h=pfs=chhon
|md=chióng
|mn=chhǹg
|w=2tshoe
|oc=n,2
|ma=y
|cat=v,n,cls,c:a
}}

====Definitions====
{{zh-hanzi}}

# to [[string]] together; to [[link]] up
# [[string]]; [[chain]]; [[series]]
# [[skewer]]
# {{zh-classifier|[[strung]], [[bunch]]ed or [[cluster]]ed objects}}
#: {{zh-x|一 串 珠子|a '''string''' of beads}}
#: {{zh-x|一 串 鞭炮|a '''string''' of firecrackers}}
#: {{zh-x|一 串 葡萄|a '''bunch''' of grapes}}
# to [[gang]] up on; to [[conspire]]; to [[collaborate]]
# to [[cross]]; to [[criss-cross]]; to [[traverse]] to; to [[mix]] (undesirably)
# to [[pay]] a [[visit]] to; to [[visit]]; to [[move]] about
# to [[play]] (a role); to [[act]]
# {{lb|zh|Cantonese}} to [[spell]] (a word in Roman letters)
# {{lb|zh|Cantonese|slang|may be derived from {{zh-l|*串聯}} during the {{w|Cultural Revolution}}}} [[cocksure]]; [[arrogant]]; [[cocky]]
# {{lb|zh|Cantonese|slang}} [[sarcastic]]
